title: DonorsChoose.org

On what does data science mean to donorschoose.org?
And we love doing it.
So today I'll talk about some examples of how we're doing it.

1st is our data science team focuses on internal business processes and improving our product as well as publishing insights on educational statistics and informing the public of what's happening inside the classrooms.
Donorschoose.org for those who don't know, is online charity that is like Kickstarter for classrooms.
Teachers come online, poster project and citizen donors.
You and I come onto the website to support those classroom projects.
Since its inception, we funded over quarter billion dollars in classroom supplies.
They have reached over 10 million kids and we were very blessed to be ranked.
One of the top 10 most innovative companies in the world by Fast Company just this very year, the first time a nonprofit made that list.
One of the publications and blog posts which we will elaborate on and hopefully bring to a broader audience, concerns duty security over Great Recession after that.
Nate well we've discovered on this very cumbersome chart.

Is that essential supplies such as pencils and paper in relation to enrichment supplies such as 3D printers, underwater robots, butterfly cocoons and so forth have been increasing in demand in highest poverty schools across the United States.
There's been a 5% increase in growth in these essential things that ought to be in the classrooms in the 1st place as compared to schools that are wealthier.

So the recession had a regressive and a disproportionate impact, and one of our hopes and our visions with data is to enable governments and Department of Education and lobbyists and so forth to be able to respond to educational inequality with more targeted and responsive approaches.
We love building products.
One example of a product that we're currently working on is answering a very simple question.
How does blank compare to the rest?
And so this is.
An example of how Chicago schools compared to the rest of the country in terms of what is being needed in those classrooms.
So books have trended over the years, and the X axis is 2006.

Thirty 2014 have been trending disproportionately higher than the rest of the country, while technology doesn't seem to be, as in is in great demand in Chicago schools or the rest of the country and that could be partly explained since 2012.

By a huge purchase of technological supplies, but the Department of Education in Illinois overall, the trend could be somewhat explained by the fact that a lot of urban schools are high poverty schools as defined by the percentage of free or reduced lunch.
We also do text mining and discover things like this.
How do Miss versus Mrs versus Mr.
Compare in terms of teachers posting requests on our website?
So we've analyzed the language of those requests, you know, project essays.
And we found that misters are more likely to swear, express sadness and use terms.
We are our miss.
I'm a positive and friendly use.
I, my and Mrs and this is the interesting, curious case of MRSA to talk about family, but also tend to use more sexual words.

Some example you know some examples are like hard and the subject matter or I won't go into the details, but so so we discovering some of these interesting interesting trends in our text and what teachers are talking about.
And some insights are just for pure fun, so this is a question to you, which Zodiacs and feel free to shout it out.
Which Zodiac signs do you think are the most generous from our donor base?
Nice, somebody said Capricorn Point to you and which one is the least generous?
Did somebody say cancer cancer alright?
And here's the chart.
As a deviation from the average from the mean, cancer is the least generous and Capricorn is the most generous.
This is my favorite quote.

This is part of what we do every day as part of our data science work and one of the challenges that I'd love to leave the audience with and love to involve you get involved with you on is a school genome, very much like the genome that this year of Bloomberg talked about a little bit ago.
We would love to be able be able to zoom in on areas on schools and to map out the needs in those classrooms as well as supplies with which teachers are.
Innovating almost in real time and correlate all the data.
Social demographic indicators in those regions.
So we'd love your help on that.
Thank you.
